title: User query: Plan description from client LLM
log: Create a Wayang plan that finds all the purchases in the household appliances file for purchases made in october 2025. It should only include purchases for organisation which have more than 10 departments, also return the creditor name of these purchases as well as the price and the purchase line. Output in a textfile.

title: Agent: SpecifierAgent Output
log:
Create an Apache Wayang plan with the following requirements:

- Input: the household appliances purchases file.
- Filter: retain only purchases with a purchase date in October 2025 (from 2025-10-01 to 2025-10-31, inclusive).
- Filter: retain only purchases where the purchasing organization has more than 10 departments.
- Output fields: creditor_name, price, purchase_line.
- Output format: write the result to a text file.

log.thoughts: Selecting factpurchases for purchase data and date filter, creditor to get creditor names, department to compute organisations with more than 10 departments via organisation_id counts, and household_appliances as the list to match against invoice_line_descr.

steps.detailed_description: Load the following inputs: (a) factpurchases table with columns [purchase_id, organisation_id, department_id, creditor_id, invoice_id, invoice_date, invoice_line_no, invoice_line_descr, invoice_line_price]; (b) department table with columns [department_id, organisation_id, name, operation_center, esyn]; (c) creditor table with columns [creditor_id, name, creditor_type]; (d) household_appliances text file (read line-by-line as appliance keywords).

Prepare datasets. 1) From household_appliances lines, trim and lowercase to build a distinct keyword set (appliance terms). 2) Filter factpurchases to purchases where invoice_date is between 2025-10-01 and 2025-10-31 (inclusive). 3) Further filter those purchases to keep only rows whose invoice_line_descr contains any keyword from the appliance set (case-insensitive substring match; treat nulls as non-matching). 4) From department, group by organisation_id to count departments and retain only organisation_id with count > 10, producing orgs_gt10. Outputs: purchases_filtered (subset of factpurchases) and orgs_gt10 (organisation_id list).

Join and project. First, join purchases_filtered with orgs_gt10 on organisation_id to retain only purchases from organisations with more than 10 departments. Next, join the result with creditor on creditor_id to bring the creditor.name. Finally, project the three output fields: creditor_name = creditor.name, price = invoice_line_price, purchase_line = invoice_line_descr. Output: dataset of rows [creditor_name, price, purchase_line].
Write the resulting [creditor_name, price, purchase_line] dataset to a text file in line-oriented format (one record per line).

log.thoughts: We load all required tables and the appliance keywords file, perform date and keyword filtering plus an organisation size derivation, then join to enforce the >10 departments condition and bring creditor names, and finally write the selected fields to a text file. This keeps the plan concise with one input step, one unary prep/filter step, one multi-join step, and an output step.

title: Class: StepHandler created step dependencies and queue

log.thoughts: Initialized four inputs for factpurchases, department, creditor (JDBC) and household_appliances (text file). IDs start at 1; outputs left open for subsequent steps to connect.

operations.udf: (r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val pid = r.getField(0).asInstanceOf[Int]; val descr = Option(r.getField(7)).map(_.toString.toLowerCase).getOrElse(""); val toks = descr.split("[^a-zæøå0-9]+").filter(_.nonEmpty); toks.map(t => (t, pid)).toSeq }

log.thoughts: Loaded inputs and built branches: appliance keywords (distinct), filtered October purchases matched by keywords, materialized matching purchase records, and grouped departments to organisation_ids with count > 10. Left creditor loaded and passed through for future steps.

operations.udf: (r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val desc = Option(r.getField(7)).map(_.toString.toLowerCase).getOrElse(""); val toks = if (desc.isEmpty) Array[String]() else desc.split("[^\\p{L}\\p{Nd}]+").filter(_.nonEmpty); toks.toSeq.map(w => (r, w)) }

(t: (org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record, org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record)) => { val p = t._1; val c = t._2; val creditorName = Option(c.getField(1)).map(_.toString).getOrElse(""); val price = p.getField(8); val line = Option(p.getField(7)).map(_.toString).getOrElse(""); (creditorName, price, line) }

log.thoughts: Loaded all inputs, built keyword set from text file, filtered purchases by date and via token-keyword join, deduplicated purchases, computed orgs with >10 depts, then joined purchases with orgs and creditors and projected required fields.

operations.udf: (r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val d = r.getField(5).toString; d >= "2025-10-01" && d <= "2025-10-31" }

(r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val descr = Option(r.getField(7)).map(_.toString.toLowerCase).getOrElse(""); val words = descr.split("[^a-zæøå0-9]+").filter(_.nonEmpty).toSet.toSeq; words.map(w => (w, r)) }

(t: ((org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record, Int), org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record)) => { val p = t._1._1; val c = t._2; val creditorName = c.getField(1).toString; val price = p.getField(8).toString; val descr = p.getField(7).toString; s"${creditorName} | ${price} | ${descr}" }

log.thoughts: Built full pipeline: load inputs, prepare appliance keywords and filtered purchases, compute orgs with >10 departments, join with orgs and creditors, project required fields, and write output. Ensured JDBC records handled via getField and IDs are continuous.

title: Class: StepHandler merged subplans to full plan

operations.udf: (r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val d = r.getField(5).toString; d >= "2025-10-01" && d <= "2025-10-31" }

(r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val descr = Option(r.getField(7)).map(_.toString.toLowerCase).getOrElse(""); val words = descr.split("[^a-zæøå0-9]+").filter(_.nonEmpty).toSet.toSeq; words.map(w => (w, r)) }

(t: ((org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record, Int), org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record)) => { val p = t._1._1; val c = t._2; val creditorName = c.getField(1).toString; val price = p.getField(8).toString; val descr = p.getField(7).toString; s"${creditorName} | ${price} | ${descr}" }
(r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val d = r.getField(5).toString; d >= "2025-10-01" && d <= "2025-10-31" }

(r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val descr = Option(r.getField(7)).map(_.toString.toLowerCase).getOrElse(""); val words = descr.split("[^a-z\u00e6\u00f8\u00e50-9]+").filter(_.nonEmpty).toSet.toSeq; words.map(w => (w, r)) }

(t: ((org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record, Int), org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record)) => { val p = t._1._1; val c = t._2; val creditorName = c.getField(1).toString; val price = p.getField(8).toString; val descr = p.getField(7).toString; s"${creditorName} | ${price} | ${descr}" }

log.thoughts: Validated joins and column positions, ensured October 2025 date filter and >10 departments condition, deduplicated purchases after word match, and mapped required output fields before text output. No structural issues; kept plan minimal and consistent with schema.

title: Class: PlanMapper Mapped the refined plan finalized for execution

data.table: (SELECT purchase_id, organisation_id, department_id, creditor_id, invoice_id, invoice_date, invoice_line_no, invoice_line_descr, invoice_line_price FROM factpurchases) as X

data.udf: (r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val d = r.getField(5).toString; d >= "2025-10-01" && d <= "2025-10-31" }

(r: org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record) => { val descr = Option(r.getField(7)).map(_.toString.toLowerCase).getOrElse(""); val words = descr.split("[^a-z\u00e6\u00f8\u00e50-9]+").filter(_.nonEmpty).toSet.toSeq; words.map(w => (w, r)) }

data.table: (SELECT department_id, organisation_id, name, operation_center, esyn FROM department) as X
(SELECT creditor_id, name, creditor_type FROM creditor) as X

data.udf: (t: ((org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record, Int), org.apache.wayang.basic.data.Record)) => { val p = t._1._1; val c = t._2; val creditorName = c.getField(1).toString; val price = p.getField(8).toString; val descr = p.getField(7).toString; s"${creditorName} | ${price} | ${descr}" }

title: Wayang: Wayang plan sent to Wayang
